path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Binamon Z1 Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Missing Address Validation
findings.description: Certain functions lack a safety check in the address; the address-type argument should include a zero-address test; otherwise, the contract's functionality may become inaccessible, or tokens may be burned in perpetuity.

findings.title: Usage of BlockTimeStamp
findings.description: The variable block.timestamp does not always reflect the current time and may be inaccurate due to miner influence.

findings.title: Denial of Service in Transactions [Restricted Mode]
findings.description: An attacker can exploit the modifier launchRestrict by calling the function transfer or transferFrom using the address of the Victim as a receiver and an owner with numToken equal to 0, thus launching a denial service attack on the contract.
